refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The while clause must be terminated by "end".

para.literal: while expr do instructions,...[,else instructions], end
while expr then instructions,...[,else instructions], end

listitem.para: The only constraint is that each then or do keyword must be on the same line as while keyword.

Keywords then or do can be replaced by a carriage return or a comma. For compatibility with Matlab it is also possible, but not recommended, to put a space between the end of the expression and the beginning of the first instruction.
The optional [,else instructions] construction allows to gives instructions which are executed when expr expression becomes false.

refsection.para: According to the Code Conventions for the Scilab Programming Language it is recommended:

listitem.para: Start each statement on a new line.
Write no more than one simple statement per line.
Break compound statements over multiple lines.

refsection.programlisting: i = 0; while i<5 disp("i"); i = i + 1; end

para.warning: Warning: the number of characters used to define the body of any conditional instruction (if while for or select/case) must be limited to 16k.
